content: I'm pretty sure Grothendieck fibrations are algebras of a K Z monad. Anyone have a reference? I am particularly interested in like, 2 categorical fibrations or bicategorical fibrations but I'll take the 1 categorical case if that's all we have a reference for
A reference is ยง3 of Street's Fibrations in bicategories.
I believe that Street's Fibrations and Yoneda's lemma in a 2-category is also a reference, but I do not have institutional access at the moment to check.
IIRC it is also explained in one of the last chapters of Jacobs' book on categorical logic
